document_data.name: Rielev
document_data.mainbody:
'''Rielev''' was a tortured experiment captured by the cruel [[archmage]] named [[Jon Irenicus]] some years before [[1369 DR]].
{{quote|''I am... dying... or dead... I remember not which. Where is the master?''|Rielev the Tortured One}}
document_data.History: Rielev was trapped in a torturous existence within a glass chamber sometime before the {{YearlinkName|1369}} and kept in [[Jon Irenicus's Dungeon]] and laboratory deep underneath the city of [[Athkatla]] in [[Amn]]. Once, Rielev was a loyal servant to Jon Irenicus. The poor wretch's existence was clouded in oblivion and ambiguity, stuck between life and death. According to their clouded memory, Irenicus was a friend and of the same people as the tortured experiment. Rielev was promised eternal life and youth in reward for their service; until then, Irenicus suspended them in a glass chamber, eventually forgetting or not caring for Rielev's fate. They asked for death and freedom from unending torture. The unfortunate soul's life was fueled by an energy source. Rielev asked [[Abdel Adrian]], who recently escaped Irenicus's clutches, to remove the batteries, thus ending their existence.
